comments.body: strange that it's not in the constructor - https://cesium.com/docs/cesiumjs-ref-doc/Model.html?classFilter=model#Model
Does the callback parameter need to be optional? https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/do-s-and-don-ts.html#optional-parameters-in-callbacks
done, amended. Thanks for the review!
The documentation does not specify that `CallbackProperty` works for this: https://cesium.com/docs/cesiumjs-ref-doc/Entity.html?classFilter=entity
Well it works. and every property can be CallbackProperty by definition of the CallbackProperty
It's correct that this property is optional (and others as well), though the documentation does not say it is. It may be worth moving all of them to be optional to be more correct with the source.

This breaks our application with the following errors:
`error TS2339: Property 'getValue' does not exist on type 'Property | Cartesian3[] | PolygonHierarchy'.`
I have pushed a fix here: https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/44648
you can remove the `getValue` from your code and use only `.hierarchy`

No, that will not work properly. Cesium takes any value set for `hierarchy` and automatically wraps it in `Property`. If you open this sandcastle and look at the log, you will see that `PolygonGraphics.hierarchy.positions` is `undefined`, even though it was originally set with a `PolygonHierarchy` and not a `Property`:

https://sandcastle.cesium.com/#

@jrafidi thanks. what a mess. I saw your fix, it still removes actual possible acceptable values by cesium. e.g : `semiMajorAxis: Property | number;` -> `semiMajorAxis: Property;`

Though, thanks for the support.
Yes, I wish that we could describe different set/get types in typescript, but at the moment we can't.

This breaks our application with the following error:
`error TS2339: Property 'getValue' does not exist on type 'Property | Cartesian3[].`
